entries.name: Phase Ambiguity (multi-valuedness axiom)
entries.description: Multi-valuedness comes from the (2π)-quotient on phase. Starting axiom motivating the Phase-Lift framework.

entries.name: Phase-Lift operator definition (⧉)
entries.equation_latex: (\,\,\,\,\,\u29c9 f\,\,\,)(z;\theta_{\rm ref}) := f(z)\ \text{computed using}\ \theta_R=\mathrm{unwrap}(\arg z;\theta_{\rm ref})
entries.description: Defines Phase-Lift as explicit phase resolution (branch selection) via unwrapping.

entries.name: Deterministic Unwrapping Rule
entries.description: Pick the representative closest to the reference. The concrete algorithm behind Phase-Lift: a single deterministic formula for branch selection.

entries.name: Path Continuity (Stateful Phase-Lift)
entries.description: Turns phase into a continuous real trajectory by chaining the unwrap rule sample-to-sample (except at true singularities like z=0).

entries.name: PR-Root as a special case of Phase-Lift (⧉√)
entries.description: Phase-resolved square root: deterministic branch choice encoded by the resolved phase.

entries.name: Winding Number + ℤ₂ Parity Invariants
entries.description: Counts how many times the lifted phase winds (w); ℤ₂ parity b predicts whether PR-Root returns to the same or opposite sheet.

entries.name: Adaptive-π Conformal Scale Factor and Metric
entries.description: πₐ/π acts like a local ruler scaling. Defines the conformal metric induced by the adaptive-π field on the underlying flat geometry.

entries.name: Adaptive Arc Length
entries.description: Distances and penalties are measured in the adaptive geometry: path lengths scale with the local πₐ field.

entries.name: Adaptive-π field definition + limit (πₐ → π)
entries.description: Generalizes the phase wrap unit; reduces to standard 2π wrapping when πₐ becomes constant π.

entries.name: Reinforce/Decay Dynamics for πₐ
entries.description: πₐ increases under stimulus (events/errors/curvature) and relaxes toward π₀ (often π). The core adaptive mechanism of the geometry layer.

entries.name: ARP Core Law (canonical ODE)
entries.description: Canonical Adaptive Resistance Principle update rule for edge conductance. Edges that carry activity reinforce; unused edges decay (self-organizing backbones).

entries.name: Curvature as Salience (Curve-Memory Primitive)
entries.description: Salience equals curvature: sharp bends in a trajectory mark events and transitions. Defines the geometric primitive used by curve-memory.

entries.name: Reinforce/Decay Memory Law (generic)
entries.description: A generic time-constant memory law: M grows under stimulus S and decays at rate μ. Can drive s(x,t) for πₐ or any curve-memory trace.

entries.name: Phase-Lifted Stokes Quantization (Adaptive-π)
entries.description: Turns the usual Stokes/holonomy statement ‘mod 2π’ into an exact equality by Phase-Lifting the phase (real-valued branch) and explicitly tracking the integer sector w; adaptive-π generalizes the period to 2πₐ.

entries.name: ARP Redshift Law (derived mapping)
entries.description: A redshift-like relaxation emerges when an ARP-governed transport variable is mapped to a normalized deficit observable.

entries.name: BZ-Averaged Phase-Lifted Complex Conductance Update (Entropy-Gated)
entries.source: derived: Core Eqs 2–4, 6–7, 10–11 + Leaderboard #3 + #10 (chat: PR Root Guide convo 2026-02-22)
entries.description: Canonical entropy-gated Phase-Lifted ARP conductance update. Single traceable boxed equation with 4 supporting definitions (all from Core + #3/#10). Entropy dynamics are 2nd-law safe; BZ ruler self-consistency feeds a uniform m_eff into QWZ preserving the single Chern jump.

entries.name: AHC Parity Flip-Rate (locking observable)
entries.description: The key AHC observable: fraction of consecutive steps where parity flips. AHC prediction: r_b drops when α_π/μ_π is high enough ('parity locking'). This is the primary testable quantity for the qubit Berry-loop experiment.

entries.name: BZ-Averaged Ruler Coupling for Single-Jump QWZ Transition
entries.description: BZ-average removes k-oscillation: <(1+ε cosλ)^{-1}> = (1-ε^2)^{-1/2}, giving a uniform m_eff(ε) and a single Chern jump at ε_c (for m0=-1: ε_c=√3/2).

entries.name: AHC Adaptive Step-Limit Update (πₐ clip)
entries.description: Core AHC innovation: clip the residual to adaptive bounds ±πₐ. Prevents single-run glitches from causing a branch jump. The key robustness mechanism.

entries.name: pi_a-Modulated QWZ Mass (momentum-dependent; re-entrant transitions)
entries.description: Couples the QWZ topological mass to the adaptive ruler, making m_eff depend on k_x; numerically produces multiple gap closings and re-entrant Chern sectors.

entries.name: AHC Running Winding + Parity
entries.description: Live winding number and parity from the lifted-phase trajectory. w_k counts total accumulated windings; b_k = (-1)^w_k gives the sheet parity at each step.

entries.name: Phase-Coupled Stability Threshold Law
entries.description: Adds a phase-coupled suppression term to ARP: conductance growth is damped by lifted phase accumulation relative to the local period 2ÃƒÂÃ¢â€šÂ¬ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â‚¬Å¡Ã‚Â. Predicts a sharp stability/transition-like behavior when ÃƒÅ½Ã‚Â¸_R approaches half-integer multiples of ÃƒÂÃ¢â€šÂ¬ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â‚¬Å¡Ã‚Â (maximal sinÃƒâ€šÃ‚Â²). Assumptions: ÃƒÅ½Ã‚Â¸_R,ij is a Phase-Lifted (unwrapped) phase-like observable for edge current; ÃƒÂÃ¢â€šÂ¬ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â‚¬Å¡Ã‚Â sets the relevant phase period; ÃƒÅ½Ã‚Â» has units 1/time.

entries.name: AHC Adaptive πₐ Update (discrete)
entries.description: Discrete version of πₐ dynamics for the AHC loop: widens bound after events (α_π S_k term), relaxes toward π₀ otherwise.

entries.name: ARP Redshift Law with Bounded Oscillatory Steering
entries.description: A redshift-relaxation bypass law with bounded oscillatory steering. Keeps ARP exponential approach while adding controlled wobble without sign flips when epsilon is constrained.

entries.name: Phase-Lifted Complex Conductance Update
entries.description: Complex-admittance lift of ARP: conductance grows along the instantaneous current phasor direction using a Phase-Lifted (unwrapped) phase. Assumes phase-coherent transport where a complex ~G is meaningful. Optional variant: include a Z2 parity factor b_ij = (-1)^{w_ij} multiplying e^{iÃƒÅ½Ã‚Â¸_R,ij} to model sign flips under branch crossings.

entries.name: AHC Candidate Unwrap (standard 2π lift)
entries.description: Apply standard 2π unwrap to each Ramsey measurement relative to the previous lifted phase. First step of the AHC control loop.

entries.name: AHC Residual
entries.description: Difference between the unwrapped measurement and the previous lifted-phase state. Feeds the step-limit gate.

entries.name: Temperature-Dependent Conductance Law
entries.description: Extends ARP equilibrium with an exponential temperature factor for material sensitivity.

entries.name: AHC Event Stimulus (phase-jump indicator)
entries.description: Binary indicator: 1 when a residual exceeds the current πₐ bound, 0 otherwise. Alternative: curvature-based S_k ∝ |Δ²θ_R|. Triggers πₐ widening.

entries.name: ARP Lyapunov Stability Form
entries.equation_latex: V(x)\ge 0,\ V(0)=0;\ \dot V(x)=\nabla V\cdot \dot x\le -\alpha V(x)
entries.description: Candidate stability proof template for adaptive conductance dynamics.

entries.name: ARP as Gradient Flow in Adaptive-π Geometry
entries.description: Bridge theorem: ARP reinforcement is proportional to edge energy contributions in a πₐ-weighted Dirichlet landscape. ARP is a 'lazy' gradient flow where Ω = π_a/π changes what counts as a short/cheap path. Prediction: increasing πₐ in a region re-routes the ARP backbone away, even under the same boundary forcing. 'πₐ sculpts geodesics; ARP discovers them.'

entries.name: Curve Memory Fine-Structure Emergence
entries.description: Formalizes the emergence of the inverse fine-structure constant (ÃƒÅ½Ã‚Â±ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚ÂÃ‚Â»Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â¹ ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â‚¬Â°Ã‹â€  137) via resonant harmonic conditions in curve memory, assuming an equilibrium state governed by ARP-influenced boundary dynamics.

entries.name: Shielding Mechanism Law (ARP)
entries.description: Proposes a shielding effect in ARP systems, modeled as a fractional reduction of the external field. The effective field is E_eff = (1 ÃƒÂ¢Ã‹â€ Ã¢â‚¬â„¢ ÃƒÅ½Ã‚Â»)E_ext, while the induced adaptive current follows J_adapt = ÃƒÂÃ†â€™E_ext, with 0 < ÃƒÅ½Ã‚Â» < 1.

entries.name: Parity Pump (πₐ-gradient ℤ₂ flip mechanism)
entries.description: Novel mechanism: parity can flip due to geometry-field motion, not only due to circling a branch point. A Z₂ pump controlled by ln(πₐ) dynamics. Conjecture: if Δθ=0 but ∫ d(ln πₐ) ≠ 0 over a closed loop, admissible lifts exist where b_a flips — the adaptive-π analog of geometric phase without dynamical phase.

entries.name: Unified Dynamic Constants Law
entries.description: First-order linear coupling for adaptive updates of ÃƒÂÃ¢â€šÂ¬ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â‚¬Å¡Ã‚Â, e, ÃƒÂÃ¢â‚¬Â¢, and c, expressing networked rates of changeÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Âmodels the unification of ARP, AIN, and ÃƒÂÃ¢â€šÂ¬ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â‚¬Å¡Ã‚Â system parameters.

entries.name: πₐ-Gauged Phase-Lift (adaptive unwrap + invariants)
entries.description: Generalizes Phase-Lift unwrapping from fixed 2π to adaptive 2πₐ: sheet jumps happen in units of the local identification length. Derives πₐ-gauged winding w_a and ℤ₂ shadow parity b_a. Novel: the unit of winding is no longer constant, coupling topology to a geometry field.

entries.name: Redshift-ARP Superconductivity Law
entries.description: Proposes a cosmological scaling for critical superconducting resistance: R_s(z) = R_{s,0} (1+z)^alpha. Assumes layered structure, universal conductance constant, ARP regime dominant.

entries.name: Adaptive Phase-Lift Unwrap Recurrence (pi_a-gauged)
entries.description: Adaptive Phase-Lift recurrence: unwrap arg using local identification length 2π_a (not fixed 2π); yields integer sheet count and Z2 parity tracking.

entries.name: Weighted Dirichlet Energy (ARP learns Omega-geodesics)
entries.description: Graph Dirichlet energy with adaptive-π weights Ω_ij; suggests ARP reinforcement concentrates conductance on Ω-weighted shortest paths / backbones.

entries.name: U(N) Det-Phase on Lifted Branch
entries.description: Same Phase-Lift bookkeeping (integer winding + ℤ₂ shadow) applied to the determinant phase of U(N) holonomy. Bridges the U(1) parity framework to non-abelian gauge systems.

entries.name: Adaptive Connection and Adaptive Chern Number (Theorem B candidate)
entries.description: Defines a rescaled connection Â=A/(2π_a) and curvature F̂=dÂ; C_a is integer-valued when the rescaling is globally well-defined.

entries.name: Parity Pump Law from Adaptive Chern
entries.description: Mod-2 holonomy/parity flip controlled by the integer adaptive Chern invariant.

entries.name: Curve-Memory Integration State (unified closed loop)
entries.description: Defines a unified integration state s(t) = (θ_R, w_a, b_a, π_a, M_k) bundling Phase-Lift, winding/parity, adaptive-π, and curve-memory features. Curve-memory curvature drives π_a, π_a changes phase unwrapping sensitivity, parity flips become detectable stable motifs. Turns topological sheet changes into an event grammar.

entries.name: U(N) Wilson / Holonomy
entries.description: Path-ordered exponential giving the U(N) holonomy around a closed loop γ. Extends the Phase-Lift framework beyond the U(1) case to non-abelian gauge fields.

entries.name: Dimensionless Lifted Phase Flow (pi_a-driven pump term)
entries.description: Defines φ=θ_R/(2π_a) and shows π_a dynamics can drive half-integer crossings (a Z2 pump mechanism) even with smooth θ_R.

entries.name: Adaptive Monodromy Spectrum (bifurcation framework)
entries.description: For loop families γ_λ under πₐ evolution, the Adaptive Monodromy Pair M_a(γ) = (w_a, b_a) ∈ ℤ × {±1} traces out a reachable set that can bifurcate: parity flips occur without classical winding as (α_π, μ_π) or CM thresholds vary. Defines a research program: map bifurcation diagrams of M_a vs parameters.

entries.name: Adaptive Discriminant Set for Parity/Winding Stability
entries.description: Singular set where the lift can fail and winding/parity may change; away from D, w and b are homotopy invariants.

entries.name: Engineered Pinch-to-Transition Mass Drive (single-jump toy)
entries.description: Monotone coupling that forces one Chern jump near ε→1^- (useful as a controllable toy model; clamp to trivial mass after the discriminant).

entries.name: Phase (Adler/RSJ) Dynamics
entries.description: Unwrapped phase difference φ(t) tries to run at detuning Δ, but adaptive coupling λG can pull it into a locked fixed point. Backbone equation of the parity-locking mechanism. Textbook Adler/RSJ form with ARP-adaptive coupling.

entries.name: Generic ARP Reinforce/Decay Law
entries.description: Conductance/coupling G increases with activity A(φ,G) at gain α, and relaxes toward baseline G₀ at rate μ. The workhorse ARP law in its most general continuous-time form.

entries.name: Activity Closure A = G|sinφ| (Parity Lock Mechanism)
entries.description: The same phase mismatch that produces restoring torque (sinφ) also teaches the coupling. This tight self-referential closure is what makes parity locking possible — the key novel ingredient of Paper I.

entries.name: Slip-Regime Asymptote (1/π Signature)
entries.description: When coupling can't lock, φ̇→Δ, so parity flips at a universal rate set by detuning. With Δ=1, r_b = 1/π ≈ 0.3183. This is the falsifiable signature: any experiment measuring parity flip rate in slip must converge to |Δ|/π.

entries.name: Noise-Robust Langevin Extension (Rounded Transition)
entries.description: Adds phase diffusion to the Adler/RSJ dynamics. Locking becomes 'almost locked' with exponentially rare slips; the sharp lock/slip transition rounds but remains detectable via r_b. Essential for any real experimental comparison.

entries.name: QWZ Chern-Insulator Hamiltonian (Reference Form)
entries.description: The canonical 2D Chern insulator (Qi–Wu–Zhang). In Step 2, the simulator realizes the real-space version with open boundaries and a time-dependent effective mass u_eff(t). Fully validated via FHS lattice Chern number in multiple tools.

entries.name: Adaptive Geometry → Effective Mass Channel (Step-2 Coupling)
entries.description: The adaptive-π conformal ruler feeding directly into the QWZ mass term. If u_eff(t) crosses 0 or ±2, the Chern phase can switch — without external tuning, purely via ARP reinforcement + memory. This is Paper I's central claim: geometry drives topology autonomously.

entries.name: Real-Space Chern Marker (Bianco–Resta, Open Boundaries)
entries.description: Computes a local topological marker from the occupied-state projector P. The simulator bulk-averages C(r) over interior sites to estimate the Chern number in an inhomogeneous, adaptive lattice. Standard diagnostic but not yet implemented in the open-boundary sim code.

entries.name: Mesh-Synced Certificate Consistency
entries.description: Chain-level consistency metric for equation certificates across synchronized nodes.

entries.name: Adaptive Entropy Production Rate (AEPR)
entries.equation_latex: dS/dt = sigma_S * sum_ij(G_ij * |I_ij|^2) - kappa_S * (S - S_0) - xi_S * S * r_b
entries.description: Dynamical equation for entropy evolution in adaptive networks: Term 1 — Ohmic dissipation (entropy produced by current flow through G_ij), Term 2 — Thermal relaxation (entropy decays toward baseline S_0), Term 3 — Parity bleed (high parity-flip rate r_b drains entropy, stabilizing the network).

entries.name: Adaptive Entropy Production Rate (AEPR)
entries.description: Dynamical equation for entropy evolution in adaptive networks: Term 1 — Ohmic dissipation (entropy produced by current flow through G_ij), Term 2 — Thermal relaxation (entropy decays toward baseline S_0), Term 3 — Parity bleed (high parity-flip rate r_b drains entropy, stabilizing the network). Closes the EGATL feedback loop by quantifying how topological updates dissipate or harvest entropy.

entries.name: HLATN_White_Paper — eqn 7
entries.description: Conductance ODE with drive, leak, and phase-suppression gate.

entries.name: HLATN_White_Paper — eqn 10
entries.description: Resolved-phase update with wrap-to-\pi and clipping by adaptive bound.

entries.name: HLATN_White_Paper — eqn 11
entries.description: Plaquette holonomy as signed sum of resolved edge phases.

entries.name: HLATN Three-Force Conductance Lock
entries.description: Conductance feedback law combining current-driven reinforcement, linear leak, and a phase-suppression gate keyed to the adaptive angular ruler. Core equation of HLATN framework — drives self-organized topological stabilization.

entries.name: HLATN Phase-Lift Branch-Safe Update
entries.description: Resolved-phase update rule with wrap-to-pi and adaptive clipping. Prevents uncontrolled branch jumps by bounding per-step angular movement to the entropy-regulated ruler pi_a.

entries.name: HLATN Plaquette Holonomy
entries.description: Plaquette holonomy computed as signed sum of resolved edge phases around a plaquette boundary. Combined with winding number w_p = round((Theta_p - Theta_p0)/(2pi)), this defines the Z2 parity locking order parameter.

entries.name: Entropy-Modulated Phase-Lift Conductance Equation (EM-PLC)
entries.description: Winding-aware, entropy-gated, suppression-coupled adaptive conductance law. Three structural couplings: (1) entropy-weighted reinforcement proportional to S(t), (2) phase-position selectivity via cos(theta_R/2pi_a) embedding branch geometry into conductance evolution, (3) quadratic winding-penalty stabilization suppressing runaway multi-sheet excursions. Coupled with adaptive bound dynamics d(pi_a)/dt = alpha_pi*S(t) - mu_pi*(pi_a - pi_0) + eta_pi*r_b and parity-mass coupling m_eff = m_0 + beta*<Delta_theta_R^2>/(2*pi_a)^2 - gamma*r_b.

entries.name: EGATL Phase-Coupled Conductance Update
entries.description: Minimal edge update with phase-coupled suppression. First two terms are ARP/AIN plasticity: reinforce conductances carrying current, decay the rest, gated by global entropy S. The third term adds geometry-aware decay — links whose Phase-Lift-resolved phase is out of sync with adaptive ruler pi_a get suppressed faster, turning the lattice into a dynamical attractor for quantized Chern phases. Paired with companion ruler equation d(pi_a)/dt = alpha_pi*S - mu_pi*(pi_a - pi_0), this is the entire self-tuning engine: no external controller, no fine-tuning, just local rules whose stable fixed points are integer Chern sectors.

entries.name: Slack Test Equation
entries.description: Test submission from Slack intake path.

entries.name: Adaptive Entropy Production Rate (AEPR)
entries.equation_latex: dS/dt = sigma_S * sum(G_ij * |I_ij|^2) - kappa_S * (S - S_0) - xi_S * S * r_b
entries.source: Derived from EGATL Phase-Coupled Conductance framework
entries.description: Entropy production rate for adaptive neural-mesh networks. First term: Ohmic dissipation from conductance-weighted currents. Second term: relaxation toward baseline entropy S_0. Third term: entropy drain coupled to parity-flip birth rate r_b. Closes the EGATL feedback loop by quantifying how topological updates dissipate or harvest entropy.

entries.name: Adaptive Damped Harmonic Oscillator
entries.description: Classical damped harmonic oscillator with adaptive-π curvature correction on the damping coefficient, allowing the decay envelope to respond to local geometric phase accumulation.

entries.name: Grok Surprise-Augmented Phase-Lifted Entropy-Gated Conductance Update
entries.description: Direct extension of the #1 ranked BZ-averaged phase-lifted entropy-gated conductance update. Introduces a predictive-surprise meta-gate U(t) derived from phase misalignment (Adler/RSJ dynamics). When the network is uncertain (high U), reinforcement accelerates and decay slows â€” implementing active, curiosity-driven adaptation and uncertainty reduction in the ARP framework.

entries.name: Gemini Curve-Memory Topological Frustration Pruning
entries.description: A structural counter-balance to curiosity-driven updates. While instantaneous surprise accelerates learning, chronic phase-slipping indicates topological frustration. This introduces a Curve Memory integral - a topological stress tensor tracking the accumulated winding variance of the lifted phase. Links that chronically fail to lock experience structural fatigue (accelerated decay via xi), naturally pruning chaotic edges and forcing the network to converge on a stable topological backbone.

entries.name: EGATL-HLATN-AEPR-AdaptiveEntropyProduction
entries.description: Full 2nd-law-safe entropy evolution closing the EGATL loop. Ohmic production (currents → S↑), thermal relaxation to baseline, parity-bleed stabilization (r_b drains S when flips are high). Directly gates all α/μ/π_a rates. Falsifiable via dissipation-vs-flip correlation.

entries.name: EGATL-HLATN-ThreeForceConductance
entries.description: HLATN three-force core law. Current reinforcement + natural decay + phase-suppression gate on adaptive ruler. Exactly what builds the persistent orange backbone paths that enforce Z₂ locking in simulations.

entries.name: EGATL-HLATN-PhaseLiftUpdate
entries.description: Branch-safe phase-lift with adaptive clipping. Guarantees consistent integer windings w_p and prevents runaway 2π jumps — the foundation of holonomy bookkeeping and parity attractors.

entries.name: EGATL-HLATN-AdaptiveRuler
entries.description: Entropy-breathing adaptive angular bound. High event activity expands π_a (more phase budget); low activity relaxes it. Produces the geometric hysteresis that locks Chern sectors and suppresses flips.

entries.name: EGATL-HLATN-PlaquetteHolonomy
entries.description: Signed plaquette holonomy from lifted phases. The precise quantity whose crossings drive windings/parity flips. In locked regime Θ_p stays confined < π → r_b → 0.

entries.name: EGATL-HLATN-ParityFlipRate
entries.description: Z₂ majority parity flip rate (the key experimental observable). 1/π chaotic asymptote → 0 locked attractor. Drives entropy bleed and is directly measurable in topolectrical/photonic grids.

entries.name: Mean-Event Equilibrium for Adaptive πₐ (discrete)
entries.description: Stationary mean equilibrium of the discrete adaptive-π bound update. Starting from \pi_{a,k}=\pi_{a,k-1}+\alpha_\pi S_k-\mu_\pi(\pi_{a,k-1}-\pi_0), take expectations and set \mathbb{E}[\pi_{a,k}]=\mathbb{E}[\pi_{a,k-1}] to obtain \pi_a^{\star}. Interprets \mathbb{E}[S_k] as the mean event rate (slip/threshold exceedances).

entries.name: Topological Coherence Order Parameter (ARP Locking)
entries.description: Scalar order parameter for the ARP Z\u2082 locking phase transition. Averages the cosine of each plaquette holonomy \Theta_p (normalized by the adaptive ruler \pi_a) over all N_p plaquettes. \Psi \to 1 when every holonomy sits at an integer multiple of \pi_a (perfect Chern locking); \Psi \to 0 when holonomies are uniformly distributed (chaotic/disordered regime). Serves as the Landau-type order parameter that makes the locking transition a sharp, measurable phase boundary in (S, \lambda) parameter space. Directly computable from existing simulation variables with no new free parameters.

entries.name: Schrödinger Equation
entries.description: Schrödinger's equation rewritten via the Madelung decomposition with Phase-Lift: the complex wave function splits into a continuity equation for probability density ρ and a Hamilton–Jacobi equation for lifted phase φ, eliminating the imaginary unit entirely.

entries.name: Aharonov–Bohm Effect
entries.equation_latex: \theta_R[\gamma]=\mathrm{unwrap}\!\Big(\frac{q}{\hbar}\oint_\gamma \mathbf A\cdot d\mathbf\ell;\;\theta_{\rm ref},\pi_a\Big)=\frac{q}{\hbar}\int_S \mathbf B\cdot d\mathbf S + 2\pi_a w
entries.description: The Aharonov–Bohm phase expressed through Phase-Lift with explicit winding-number sectors. The unwrap operator removes branch-cut ambiguity and tracks accumulated windings w ∈ ℤ around the solenoid.

entries.name: Berry Phase
entries.description: Berry's geometric phase computed as a discrete sum of unwrapped overlap arguments along a closed parameter path. Phase-Lift eliminates the multivalued Arg ambiguity at each step.

entries.name: Josephson Relations
entries.description: The DC and AC Josephson relations with adaptive-π scaling. The standard sin(φ) current–phase relation becomes sin(πθ_R/π_a), where π_a is an adaptive period parameter that recovers the classical limit when π_a → π.

entries.name: Maxwell's Equations
entries.equation_latex: \mathbf E=-\nabla V-\partial_t\mathbf A,\quad \mathbf B=\nabla\times\mathbf A,\quad \theta_R=\mathrm{unwrap}\!\Big(\frac{q}{\hbar}\oint\mathbf A\cdot d\mathbf\ell;\;\theta_{\rm ref},\pi_a\Big)
entries.description: Maxwell's field equations expressed through gauge potentials (A, V) with Phase-Lift applied to the electromagnetic phase. The winding structure of A around closed loops is tracked explicitly via the unwrap operator, connecting classical electrodynamics to the quantum phase framework.

entries.name: Dirac Equation
entries.description: The Dirac equation for a free spin-½ particle with the four-component spinor decomposed into amplitude √ρ, an SU(2) rotation R, and a Phase-Lifted scalar phase φ. This separates the spin degree of freedom from the Phase-Lift winding structure.

entries.name: Euler–Lagrange Equation
entries.description: The Euler–Lagrange equation applied to a Phase-Lift Lagrangian where the generalized coordinates are (ρ, θ_R, π_a). Stationarity of the Phase-Lift action yields the equations of motion for the lifted phase field and the adaptive period.

entries.name: Navier–Stokes (Vorticity Form)
entries.description: The vorticity transport equation from Navier–Stokes with Phase-Lift applied to circulation integrals. The integer winding number w counts vortex sheet crossings using the adaptive period π_a, connecting fluid topology to the phase framework.

entries.name: Feynman Path Integral
entries.equation_latex: Z=\sum_{w\in\mathbb Z}\int \mathcal D\rho\,\mathcal D\theta_R\,\mathcal D\pi_a\; e^{\frac{i}{\hbar}S_{PL}[\rho,\theta_R,\pi_a]}\;\delta\!\big(\theta_R(T)-\theta_R(0)-2\pi_a w\big)
entries.description: Feynman's path integral reformulated with Phase-Lift coordinates. The sum over winding sectors w replaces the standard sum over paths, and the delta function enforces quantized phase returns. Each sector contributes independently.

entries.name: U(N) Gauge Holonomy
entries.description: A U(N) holonomy (parallel transport around a loop γ) factored into an SU(N) part V and a U(1) determinant phase. Phase-Lift tracks the determinant phase through unwrapping, yielding an integer winding number w_det that classifies the topological sector.

entries.name: Klein–Gordon Equation
entries.description: The Klein–Gordon equation for a relativistic scalar field, with the complex field ψ decomposed into amplitude √ρ and Phase-Lifted scalar phase φ = πθ_R/π_a. This separates amplitude dynamics from phase winding in a Lorentz-covariant setting.

entries.name: Einstein Field Equations
entries.description: Einstein's field equations with a Phase-Lift conformal rescaling of the metric. The conformal factor σ(π_a) is determined by the adaptive period, linking spacetime curvature to the phase framework. When π_a → π, the standard metric is recovered.

entries.name: Fourier Heat Equation
entries.description: Fourier's heat equation augmented with a curvature-salience source term. The coefficient κ is derived from the Phase-Lift curvature K[θ_R], making regions of high phase curvature act as local heat sources. This models phase-aware diffusion.

entries.name: Noether's Theorem
entries.description: Noether's theorem applied to the Phase-Lift Lagrangian: continuous symmetries of L_PL yield conserved currents j^μ_PL. The lifted phase θ_R and adaptive period π_a each contribute to the conserved current when the action is invariant under their transformations.
